short_summary: Electrical work to install new cables and make repairs in the YFB test site in Iqaluit, Nunavut.
description: Electrical work is requested to install new electrical signal cables, electrical power cables, and fiber cables. This work will involve tracing and locating existing buried electrical signal and power cables (including those damaged in the Iqaluit fire in 2021); trenching for new cables; running new signal, power and fiber cables; terminating power cables and electrical work in the garage including adding a new electrical panel. All work must be compliant with the Nunavut electrical code and all applicable local standards. \\[...] \[...] \[...] \[...] \[...] \[...]  The requirement is subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
full_summary:
# Electrical Upgrades, YFB Test Site, Iqaluit, Nunavut

## Solicitation Overview

**Reference Number:** cb-890-15730163
**Amendment Number:** 3
**Solicitation Number:** 5000075433
**Publication Date:** 2024-05-22
**Tender Closing Date:** 2024-06-10T15:00:00 (Expired)
**Expected Contract Start Date:** 2024-06-24
**Expected Contract End Date:** 2024-09-30

## Procurement Details

The Government Institution is seeking a qualified contractor to perform electrical upgrades at the YFB Test Site in Iqaluit, Nunavut. The work involves:

* Tracing and locating existing buried electrical signal and power cables
* Trenching for new cables
* Running new signal, power, and fiber cables
* Terminating power cables and electrical work in the garage, including adding a new electrical panel.

The contractor must ensure compliance with the Nunavut Electrical Code and all applicable local standards.

## Site Details

The YFB Test Site is used for testing and evaluation of meteorological instruments and equipment. The site includes:

* Meteorological Service of Canada (MSC) Automated Weather Station (AWS)
* MSC Automated Weather Observation System (AWOS)
* NavCanada Automated Weather Observation System (NCAWOS)
* Instrument compounds for testing and evaluation

## Contract Terms

* Completion of the scope of work is anticipated within ten weeks
* The requirement is subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

## Contact Information

For additional information, interested suppliers should contact:
* Helena Lee, Phone: (778) 617-2275, Email: Helena.Lee@ec.gc.ca

## Tender Documents

Refer to the attached documents for full details and specifications:
